Headline: Philip Morris' New Campaign Echoes Medical Experts
Source Website http //www.latimes.com
Tobacco giant Phslip Morris Cos. has acknowledged that there 1s overwhelmng evidence that cigarette
smoking causes lung cancer and other diseases. in a series of public statements that all but merge the
company's stands on smoking and health with the views of leading medical experts.
The statenents appear on a new company web site benng launched today as part of a lavish
image-building campaign for Philip Morris. the world's biggest cigarette maker and a leading marketer
of food and beer through its Kraft Foods and M:ller Brewing units.
Although the tobacco tndustry has been backing away in necent years from its past denia?s that seoking
is harmful. the new statements appear to be a far nore frank admission of the risks.
Along with statements about the dangers of smoking. the Web site says that smcking is addictive. It
stops short of agreement that secondhand smoke is a proven cause of lung cancer and heart disease but
says adults should minimize smoking around chr ldren to avond endangering therr heaith.
The Web site is being launched along with an expensive Tv ad campaign highTighting PhtI1p Morris'
efforts to combat a series of sociel problens.
The company and its rivals face a flood of lawsuits over 11lnesses 1inked to smoking and secondhand
smoke. along with key legal battles over efforts to regulate the industry It was uncertain if the
Philip Morris staterents mtght s1gnal a change in courtroom strategy. though it appeared by their
wording that certain of the company's traditiona? legal defenses mght remain intact.
Philip Morris' public positions. and those of industry rivals. have been evolving over time from the
widespread derisian. In recent years. for example. the compames and therr lanyers have acknowledged
absolute denials and scathing attacks on the U S surgeon general that made them an object of
that smoking 1s a "risk factor" for cancer and other aiiments. while stopping short of calling it a
cause.
Certain of the Web site statenents are striking. however. for how littie there is to distinguish them
from the vtews of sc1entific and health organizations
On the risks to smokers, the Web site says: "There is an overwhelming nedical and scientific consensus
that cigarette smoking causes lung cancer. heart disease. erphysema and other serrous diseases. ..
Smokers are far nore likely to develop serous diseases. Tke ung cancer. than nonsmckers. There is
no "safe' cigarette. These are and have been the messages of public health authorities worldwnde.
Smokers and potential smokers should rely on these messages in making all saoking-related decisions."
Concerning addiction, it says that "smoking is addictive, as that tere is most comonly used today. It
can be very difficult to quit smoking. but this should not deter okers who want to qunt from trying
to do so."
